p: Kenichi et al reported new non-peptide SARS-CoV 3CL pro inhibitors [117] by introducing decahydroisoquinoline at the S2 position by connecting the cyclohexyl group of the substrate-based inhibitor 75 ( Fig. 11 ) [118]. The resulting compounds ( 76- 80, Fig. 11) showed moderate but very promising inhibitory activities against SARS-CoV 3CL pro, which suggested that the decahydroisoquinoline scaffold could be a novel scaffold at the S2 position for SARS-CoV 3CL pro inhibition.
